intro: Fremya deplanchei, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Fremya deplanchei is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
